Federal Reserve Watcher · Rate Decision | Date: January 25/26, 2026

Probabilistic assessment of the next Federal Reserve policy decision

As of 2025-12-16

Federal Reserve Watcher — Final Decision Engine | Meeting: January 25/26, 2026

Inputs Used: Macro Signal Synthesiser; Fed Tone Decoder; Fed Projections Synthesiser; Beige Book Summary.

  • Macro Signal: HOLD (confidence: MEDIUM) — Inflation dynamics are neutral with a disinflationary bias but PCE remains above target; labor market moderating towards slack; growth signals mixed; liquidity expanding. [Source: predictor_fed_rate_decision]
  • Behavioural Feasibility: HOLD-BIASED — Following three consecutive 25bps rate cuts in Sep, Oct, and Dec 2025, and having moved policy into a "broad range of estimates of its neutral value," the Committee is likely to pause to assess cumulative effects and incoming data. [Source: powell_dec25_pc_pdf] [Source: Federal_Reserve_Tone_Decoder.html]
  • Fed Worldview: HOLD — Median SEP projections for 2025 (3.6%) align with the current federal funds rate target range (3.5-3.75%) after the Dec 2025 cut, implying a pause at the next meeting before potential further easing in 2026. [Source: fomc_sep_dec25_rss]
  • Real-Economy Confirmation: MIXED — Economic activity "remained largely unchanged" but with noted risks of slower activity; labor market softening and modest wage growth confirmed, alongside persistent moderate price increases driven by tariffs. [Source: Federal_Reserve_Beige_Book_Summary.html]

Divergence (this is signal):

  • Macro says: HOLD
  • Behaviour says: HOLD
  • Fed worldview says: HOLD

Decision Probabilities (sum = 100%):

  • CUT: 10%
  • HOLD: 85%
  • HIKE: 5%

Forward Guidance Bias: DOVISH — Will likely emphasize continued vigilance against downside employment risks and a data-dependent approach, anchoring to the SEP's projected rate path which implies future cuts in 2026. [Source: powell_dec25_pc_pdf] [Source: fomc_sep_dec25_rss]

Surprise Risk: MEDIUM — Source: Explicit internal divergence on future policy path among FOMC participants and ongoing uncertainty surrounding economic data, especially labor market adjustments and tariff impacts. [Source: powell_dec25_pc_pdf]

Final Call: Outcome: HOLD with dovish guidance.

Self-Healing

  • RSS Documents Needed:
    • Federal Reserve issues FOMC statement (2025-12-10) — [Source: press_monetary_policy]: Provides the official FOMC statement which is critical for policy actions and risk framing.
    • Federal Reserve Board and Federal Open Market Committee release economic projections (2025-12-10) — [Source: press_monetary_policy]: Delivers the SEP which is foundational for understanding the Fed's projected worldview and dots.
    • Minutes of the Federal Open Market Committee, October 28-29, 2025 — [Source: press_monetary_policy]: Offers detailed insights into the Committee's discussions, rationale for past decisions, and future policy considerations.
  • High-Value Inputs to Add:
    • Transcripts of the latest FOMC Press Conference: Essential for interpreting Chair Powell's nuanced views and guidance.
    • Updated Summary of Economic Projections (SEP) with individual dots: Critical for gauging internal committee divergence and future rate expectations.
  • Weaknesses in Provided Inputs:
    • Many critical Federal Reserve documents (FOMC Statements, Minutes, SEPs, Press Conferences) were referenced in the `Fed Tone Decoder` and `Fed Projections Synthesiser` with `rss` links or `pdf` links but were not provided as direct HTML inputs to this module, nor were they consistently included in the `NODE_URL_MAP`. Concrete fix: Ensure all referenced Fed publications are provided as HTML inputs and are explicitly mapped in the `NODE_URL_MAP`.
